message: The bill adopted by a 388 to 25 margin would clarify that existing communication laws don't protect websites that "unlawfully promote and facilitate prostitution and contribute to sex trafficking." It would also establish prison sentences of up to 25 years for some online sex traffickers.

data.description: The bill clarifies that existing communication laws don't protect websites that "unlawfully promote and facilitate prostitution and contribute to sex trafficking."
data.title: U.S. House passes bill to fight internet sex trafficking
